communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the FBI's record retention schedule in digital format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of files on Brigid Berlin, a New York artist and socialite whose death was widely reported in the media in July 2020. Here is one example: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/arts/brigid-berlin-dead.html

According to news reports, she was born Brigid Emmett Berlin in Manhattan on Sept. 6, 1939. I request that you use those details to augment your search.

A previous FOIA request with the FBI indicated that, "Records potentially responsive to your request were transferred to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)."

The FBI said to use file number 94-HQ-4-4467 as a reference.

https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fbi-file-brigid-berlin-148599/#files

I ask that those files, and any other held by your agency, be released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: FOIA - Vernon Hills PD (IL) - Flock Safety Documents

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Vernon Hills PD (IL) - Flock Safety Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to Flock Safety (https://www.flocksafety.com) license-plate-reader hardware and/or software. Documents being requested here should include - but are not limited to - the following:

- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service
- MOUs from Flock Safety
- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety
- Privacy and/or data retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Any/all manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Guidelines mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Bulletins mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Briefings mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Use policies and standard operating procedures for Flock Safety product/services
- All emails sent (through this year) mentioning "Flock Safety" and/or "ALPR"
- Any/all digitally disseminated publications from your agency mentioning Flock Safety product/services

I am confident there are documents relevant to this request based on public literature and broadcast news video describing the use of the company's products by your agency: https://www.dailyherald.com/news/20230623/vernon-hills-plans-to-deploy-17-license-plate-reading-cameras-to-combat-organized-retail-crime

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Child Abuse Pediatrics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents regarding Anne Troy, Ph.D. F.N.B, B.C 
including but not limited to: 
her license and its standing within the State Board;  
complaints about her practice, both independently and through Children's Hospital, New Orleans/LCMC/The Audrey Hepburn Children at Risk Evaluation Center,
and findings within those complaints both positive and negative.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Molly Fowler
